title: This dual camera 4K drone can get even novice pilots airborne for under $80
content:
Macworld

Whether you’re looking to capture incredible aerial photography or need a fun gift for the techie in your life, the Ninja Dragons Blade X 4K Dual Camera Drone is an excellent idea. And it doesn’t hurt that in the often pricey drone market, this one won’t send your wallet into the stratosphere at the same time.

Featuring a six-axis gyroscope, electronic stabilization systems, and a headless design that makes aerial orientation a breeze, this user-friendly, four-rotor, durable drone has an intuitive four-channel control system for simple, directional flying. 

And for those who want to document their flights or drink in the aerial images, the Blade X sports a pair of cameras. There’s a 4K HD front-facing camera and a 720p resolution camera on the bottom for shooting spectacular photos or gorgeous video from nearly any angle.

Users can watch images in real time through their synced phone or record all the action for playback later on their iPad or another device.

Check out the other innovative features of the Blade X that make it ideal for even amateur flyers:

  • Optimized waypoint flight
  • Gesture control
  • 1-click take-off and landing technology

Upgrade your tech arsenal or gift your favorite techie this fun drone.

Get the Ninja Dragon Blade X 4K Dual Camera Drone for just $79.97 (reg. $199) through October 23rd at 11:59pm Pacific. No coupon necessary.
